message.content: This question requires knowledge about environmentally friendly behaviors. Option (A) is the correct answer because buying products that can be reused reduces waste and promotes recycling. Option (B) is incorrect because driving a gas guzzling car contributes to air pollution and uses more fossil fuels. Option (C) is incorrect because aluminum cans should be recycled rather than thrown in the trash. Option (D) is incorrect because littering in public parks is harmful to the environment and can cause pollution.

This question requires knowledge of environmentally friendly practices. Buying products that can be reused is one way to be friendlier to the environment because it reduces waste. Option (B) is incorrect because driving a gas guzzling car contributes to pollution and is not environmentally friendly. Option (C) is also incorrect because aluminum cans can be recycled and should not be thrown in the trash. Option (D) is clearly incorrect because littering in public parks is harmful to the environment.

This question requires knowledge about environmentally friendly behaviors. Option (A) is the correct answer because buying products that can be reused helps to reduce waste and minimize the use of resources. Option (B) is incorrect because driving a gas guzzling car increases carbon emissions and is harmful to the environment. Option (C) is incorrect because throwing aluminum cans in the trash contributes to landfill waste and does not promote recycling. Option (D) is incorrect because littering in public parks is harmful to the environment and contributes to pollution.

Option (C) is incorrect because aluminum cans should be recycled, not thrown in the trash. Option (D) is incorrect because littering in public parks harms the environment and can disrupt ecosystems.

To be a friend of the environment, it is important to buy products that can be reused. Option (B), driving a gas guzzling car, is incorrect because it contributes to air pollution and is not environmentally friendly. Option (C), throwing aluminum cans in the trash, is incorrect because aluminum cans can be recycled. To be a friend of the environment, it is important to make choices that are sustainable and minimize harm to the earth. Option (A) is correct because buying products that can be reused reduces waste and conserves resources. Options (B), (C), and (D) are all incorrect because they involve actions that harm the environment - driving a gas guzzling car contributes to pollution and climate change, throwing aluminum cans in the trash wastes valuable resources that can be recycled, and littering in public parks pollutes the environment and harms wildlife.

This question requires an understanding of actions that are environmentally friendly versus those that are harmful to the environment. Option (A) is the correct answer because buying products that can be reused, such as reusable water bottles or cloth shopping bags, reduces the amount of waste that goes into landfills. Option (B) is incorrect because driving a gas guzzling car contributes to air pollution and increases carbon emissions. Option (C) is also incorrect because throwing aluminum cans in the trash means they will not be recycled and reused, leading to wastefulness. Option (D) is incorrect because littering in public parks not only spoils the environment, but it also negatively impacts wildlife and creates a hazard for other people.
